ayas.translation: Ta, Seen, Meem.
These are the signs of the Manifest Book.

ayas.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: You are liable to imperil your life [out of distress] that they will not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: la`allaka bākhi`un nafsaka allā yakūnū mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
ayas.translation: If We wish We will send down to them a sign from the sky before which their heads will remain bowed in humility.
ayas.transliteration: in nasha-nunazzil `alayhim minas samā-i āyatan faẓallat a`nāquhum lahā khāḍi`īn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
ayas.translation: There does not come to them any new reminder from the All-beneficent but that they disregard it.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā ya-tīhim min dhikrin minar raḥmāni muḥdathin illā kānū `anhu mu`riḍīn

ayas.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
ayas.translation: They have already denied [the truth], but soon there will come to them the news of what they have been deriding.
ayas.transliteration: faqad kadhhabū fasaya-tīhim anbā-u mā kānū bihi yastahzi-ūn

ayas.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
ayas.translation: Have they not regarded the earth, how many of every splendid kind [of vegetation] We have caused to grow in it?
ayas.transliteration: awalam yaraw ilal-arḍi kam anbatnā fīhā min kulli zawjin karīm

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

ayas.arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: When your Lord called out to Moses: [saying,] ‘Go to those wrongdoing people,
ayas.transliteration: wa idh nādā rabbuka mūsā ani-til qawmaẓ ẓālimīn

ayas.translation: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not be wary [of Allah]?’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘My Lord! I fear they will impugn me,
ayas.transliteration: qāla rabbi innī akhāfu an yukadhhibūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
ayas.translation: and I will become upset and my tongue will fail me. So send for Aaron [to join me].
ayas.transliteration: wayaḍīqu ṣadrī walā yanṭaliqu lisānī fa-arsil ilā hārūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
ayas.translation: Besides, they have a charge against me, and I fear they will kill me.’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘Certainly not! Let both of you go with Our signs: We will indeed be with you, hearing [everything].
ayas.transliteration: qāla kallā ۖ fadh-habā bi-āyātinā ۖ innā ma`akum mustami`ūn

ayas.arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: So approach Pharaoh and say, ‘‘We are indeed envoys of the Lord of the worlds
ayas.transliteration: fa-tiyā fir`awna faqūlā innā rasūlu rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.translation: that you let the Children of Israel leave with us.’’ ’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
ayas.translation: He [i.e. Pharaoh] said, ‘Did we not rear you as a child among us, and did you not stay with us for years of your life?
ayas.transliteration: qāla alam nurabbika fīnā walīdan walabithta fīnā min `umurika sinīn

ayas.arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Then you committed that deed of yours, and you are an ingrate.’
ayas.transliteration: wafa`alta fa`latakal latī fa`alta wa-anta minal kāfirīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘I did that when I was astray.
ayas.transliteration: qāla fa`altuhā idhan wa-ana minaḍ ḍāllīn

ayas.arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
ayas.translation: So I fled from you, as I was afraid of you. Then my Lord gave me sound judgement and made me one of the apostles.
ayas.transliteration: fafarartu minkum lammā khiftukum fawahaba lī rabbī ḥukman waja`alanī minal mursalīn

ayas.arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
ayas.translation: That you have enslaved the Children of Israel—is that the favour with which you reproach me?’
ayas.transliteration: watilka ni`matun tamunnuhā `alayya an `abbadta banī isrā-iyl

ayas.translation: He said, ‘And what is ‘‘the Lord of all the worlds?’’ ’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them,—should you have conviction.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā ۖ in kuntum mūqinīn

ayas.translation: He said to those who were around him, ‘Don’t you hear?!’
He said, ‘Your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers!’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘Indeed your messenger, who has been sent to you, is surely crazy!’
ayas.transliteration: qāla inna rasūlakumul ladhī ursila ilaykum lamajnūn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘The Lord of the east and the west and whatever is between them—should you exercise your reason.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla rabbul mashriqi wal maghribi wa mā baynahumā ۖ in kuntum ta`qilūn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘If you take up any god other than me, I will surely make you a prisoner!’
ayas.transliteration: qāla la-init-takhadhta ilāhan ghayrī la-aj`alannaka minal masjūnīn

ayas.translation: He said, ‘What if I bring you something [as an] unmistakable [proof]?’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘Then bring it, should you be truthful.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla fa-ti bihi in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayas.translation: Thereat he threw down his staff, and behold, it was a manifest python.

ayas.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Then he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white and bright to the onlookers.
ayas.transliteration: wanaza`a yadahu fa-idhā hiya bayḍā-u linnāẓirīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
ayas.translation: He said to the elite [who stood] around him, ‘This is indeed an expert magician
ayas.transliteration: qāla lil-mala-i ḥawlahu inna hādhā lasāḥirun `alīm

ayas.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
ayas.translation: who seeks to expel you from your land with his magic. So what do you advise?’
ayas.transliteration: yurīdu an yukhrijakum min arḍikum bisiḥrihi famādhā ta-murūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘Put him and his brother off for a while, and send heralds to the cities
ayas.transliteration: qālū arjih wa-akhāhu wab`ath fil madā-ini ḥāshirīn

ayas.translation: to bring you every expert magician.’
So the magicians were gathered for the tryst of a known day,
and the people were told: ‘Will you all gather?!’

ayas.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
ayas.translation: ‘Maybe we will follow the magicians, if they are victors!’
ayas.transliteration: la`allanā nattabi`us saḥarata in kānū humul ghālibīn

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
ayas.translation: So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, ‘Shall we have a reward if we were to be the victors?’
ayas.transliteration: falammā jā-as saḥaratu qālū lifir`awna a-inna lanā la-ajran in kunnā naḥnul ghālibīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘Of course; and you will be among members of my inner circle.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla na`am wa innakum idhal laminal muqarrabīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
ayas.translation: Moses said to them, ‘Throw down whatever you have to throw!’
ayas.transliteration: qāla lahum mūsā alqū mā antum mulqūn

ayas.arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
ayas.translation: So they threw down their sticks and ropes, and said, ‘By the might of Pharaoh, we shall surely be victorious!’
ayas.transliteration: fa-alqaw ḥibālahum wa`iṣiyyahum waqālū bi`izzati fir`awna innā lanaḥnul ghālibūn

ayas.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
ayas.translation: Thereat Moses threw down his staff, and behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.
ayas.transliteration: fa-alqā mūsā `aṣāhu fa-idhā hiya talqafu mā ya-fikūn

ayas.translation: Thereat the magicians fell down prostrating.
They said, ‘We believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
the Lord of Moses and Aaron.’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
ayas.translation: He [i.e. Pharaoh] said, ‘Do you profess faith in Him before I should permit you? He is indeed your chief who has taught you magic! Soon you will know! I will cut off your hands and feet from opposite sides, and I will crucify you all.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla āmantum lahu qabla an ādhana lakum ۖ innahu lakabīrukumul ladhī `allamakumus siḥra falasawfa ta`lamūn ۚ la-uqaṭṭi`anna aydiyakum wa-arjulakum min khilāfin wala-uṣallibannakum ajma`īn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘[There is] no harm [in that]! Indeed, we shall return to our Lord.
ayas.transliteration: qālū lā ḍayr ۖ innā ilā rabbinā munqalibūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed we hope our Lord will forgive us our offences for being the first to believe.’
ayas.transliteration: innā naṭma`u an yaghfira lanā rabbunā khaṭāyānā an kunnā awwalal-mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
ayas.translation: Then We revealed to Moses, [saying],‘Set out with My servants at night, for you will be pursued.’
ayas.transliteration: wa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā an asri bi`ibādī innakum muttaba`ūn

ayas.translation: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities,
[proclaiming:] ‘These are indeed a small band.
They have aroused our wrath,
and we are alert and fully prepared.’
So We took them out of gardens and springs,
and [made them leave behind] treasures and stately homes.
So it was; and We bequeathed them to the Children of Israel.
Then they pursued them at sunrise.

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَـٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
ayas.translation: When the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, ‘Indeed we have been caught up.’
ayas.transliteration: falammā tarā al jam`āni qāla aṣ-ḥābu mūsā innā lamudrakūn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘Certainly not! Indeed my Lord is with me. He will guide me.’
ayas.transliteration: qāla kallā ۖ inna ma`iya rabbī sayahdīn

ayas.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
ayas.translation: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff!’ Whereupon it parted, and each part was as if it were a great mountain.
ayas.transliteration: fa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā aniḍ-rib bi`aṣākal baḥr ۖ fanfalaqa fakāna kullu firqin kaṭ ṭawdil `aẓīm

ayas.translation: There, We brought the others near,
and We delivered Moses and all those who were with him.
ayas.transliteration: wa-anjaynā mūsā wa man ma`ahu ajma`īn

ayas.translation: Then We drowned the rest.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: There is indeed a sign in that, but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
Relate to them the account of Abraham

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
ayas.translation: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?!’
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mā ta`budūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَـٰكِفِينَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘We worship idols, and are constant in our devotion to them.’
He said, ‘Do they hear you when you call them?
Or do they bring you any benefit, or cause you any harm?’

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘Indeed, we found our fathers doing likewise.’
ayas.transliteration: qālū bal wajadnā ābā-anā kadhālika yaf`alūn

ayas.translation: He said, ‘Have you regarded what you have been worshipping,
ayas.transliteration: qāla afara aytum mā kuntum ta`budūn

ayas.translation: you and your ancestors?

ayas.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: They are indeed enemies to me, but the Lord of all the worlds,
who created me, it is He who guides me,
and provides me with food and drink,
and when I get sick, it is He who cures me;
who will make me die, then He will bring me to life,

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
ayas.translation: and who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the Day of Retribution.’
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhī aṭma`u an yaghfira lī khaṭī-atī yawmad dīn

ayas.arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
ayas.translation: ‘My Lord! Grant me [unerring] judgement, and unite me with the Righteous.
ayas.transliteration: rabbi hab lī ḥukman wa-alḥiqnī biṣ ṣāliḥīn

ayas.arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Confer on me a worthy repute among the posterity,
and make me one of the heirs to the paradise of bliss.

ayas.arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
ayas.translation: Forgive my father, for he is one of those who are astray.
ayas.transliteration: waghfir li-abī innahu kāna minaḍ ḍāllīn

ayas.translation: Do not disgrace me on the day that they will be resurrected,

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
ayas.translation: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail,
ayas.transliteration: yawma lā yanfa`u mālun walā banūn

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
ayas.translation: except him who comes to Allah with a sound heart,’
and paradise will be brought near for the Godwary,
and hell will be brought into view for the perverse,

ayas.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
ayas.translation: and they shall be told: ‘Where is that which you used to worship
ayas.transliteration: waqīla lahum ayna mā kuntum ta`budūn

ayas.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
ayas.translation: besides Allah? Do they help you, or do they help each other?’
ayas.transliteration: min dūnillāhi hal yanṣurūnakum aw yantaṣirūn

ayas.translation: Then they will be cast into it on their faces—they and the perverse,
and the hosts of Iblis all together.
They will say, as they wrangle in it [together],

ayas.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
ayas.translation: ‘By Allah, we had indeed been in manifest error
ayas.transliteration: tallāhi in kunnā lafī ḍalālin mubīn

ayas.translation: when we equated you with the Lord of all the worlds!
No one led us astray except the guilty.
Now we have no intercessors,
nor do we have any sympathetic friend.

ayas.arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: Had there been another turn for us, we would be among the faithful.’
ayas.transliteration: falaw anna lanā karratan fanakūna minal mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
The people of Noah impugned the apostles

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
ayas.translation: when Noah, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum nūḥun alā tattaqūn

ayas.translation: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.
So be wary of Allah and obey me.

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.translation: So be wary of Allah and obey me.’
They said, ‘Shall we believe in you, when it is the riffraff who follow you?’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘What do I know as to what they used to do?
ayas.transliteration: qāla wa mā `il-mī bimā kānū ya`malūn

ayas.arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Their reckoning is only with my Lord, should you be aware.
ayas.transliteration: in ḥisābuhum illā `alā rabbī ۖ law tash`urūn

ayas.translation: I will not drive away the faithful.
I am just a manifest warner.’

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned [to death].’
ayas.transliteration: qālū la-in lam tantahi yānūḥu latakūnanna minal marjūmīn

ayas.translation: He said, ‘My Lord! Indeed my people have impugned me.

ayas.arabic: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: So judge conclusively between me and them, and deliver me and the faithful who are with me.’
ayas.transliteration: faftaḥ baynī wabaynahum fat-ḥan wanajjinī wa man ma`iya minal mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
ayas.translation: Thereupon We delivered him and those who were with him in the laden ark.
ayas.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa man ma`ahu fil fulkil mashḥūn

ayas.translation: Then We drowned the rest.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
[The people of] ‘Ad impugned the apostles,

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
ayas.translation: when Hud, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum hūdun alā tattaqūn

ayas.translation: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.
So be wary of Allah and obey me.

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.translation: Do you build futile a sign on every prominence?
You set up structures as if you will be immortal,
and when you seize [someone for punishment], you seize [him] like tyrants.
So be wary of Allah and obey me.
Be wary of Him who has provided you with whatever you know,
and aided you with sons and with cattle,
gardens and springs.

ayas.arabic: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
ayas.translation: Indeed I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous day.’

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘It is the same to us whether you exhort us or not.
ayas.transliteration: qālū sawā-un `alaynā awa`aẓta am lam takun minal wā`iẓīn

ayas.translation: These are nothing but the traditions of the ancients,
and we will not be punished.’

ayas.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: So they impugned him, whereupon We destroyed them. There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-ahlaknāhum ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
[The people of] Thamud impugned the apostles

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَـٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
ayas.translation: when Salih, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum ṣāliḥun alā tattaqūn

ayas.translation: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.
So be wary of Allah and obey me.

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.translation: Will you be left secure in that which is here
—amid gardens and springs,
farms and date palms with dainty spathes
—while you skillfully hew out houses from the mountains?
So be wary of Allah and obey me,
and do not obey the dictates of the transgressors,

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
ayas.translation: who cause corruption in the land and do not bring about reform.’
They said, ‘Indeed you are one of the bewitched.

ayas.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: You are just a human being like us. So bring us a sign, should you be truthful.’
ayas.transliteration: mā anta illā basharun mithlunā fa-ti bi-āyatin in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
ayas.translation: He said, ‘This is a she-camel; she shall drink and you shall drink on known days.
ayas.transliteration: qāla hādhihi nāqatun lahā shirbun walakum shirbu yawmin ma`lūm

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
ayas.translation: Do not cause her any harm, for then you shall be seized by the punishment of a terrible day.’
But they hamstrung her, whereupon they became regretful.

ayas.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: So the punishment seized them. There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: fa-akhadhahumul `adhāb ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
The people of Lot impugned the apostles

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
ayas.translation: when Lot, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla lahum akhūhum lūṭun alā tattaqūn

ayas.translation: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.
So be wary of Allah and obey me.

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.translation: What! Of all people do you come to males,

ayas.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
ayas.translation: abandoning your wives your Lord has created for you? Indeed, you are a transgressing lot.’
ayas.transliteration: watadharūna mā khalaqa lakum rabbukum min azwājikum ۚ bal antum qawmun `ādūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘Lot, if you do not desist, you will surely be banished.’
ayas.transliteration: qālū la-in lam tantahi yālūṭu latakūnanna minal mukhrajīn

ayas.translation: He said, ‘Indeed I detest your conduct.’
‘My Lord! Deliver me and my family from what they do.’
So We delivered him and all his family,
except an old woman who remained behind.
Then We destroyed [all] the rest,

ayas.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
ayas.translation: and rained down upon them a rain [of stones]. Evil was the rain of those who were warned!

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
The inhabitants of Aykah impugned the apostles,

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
ayas.translation: when Shu‘ayb said to them, ‘Will you not be wary [of Allah]?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla lahum shu`aybun alā tattaqūn

ayas.translation: Indeed I am a trusted apostle [sent] to you.
So be wary of Allah and obey me.

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: I do not ask you any reward for it; my reward lies only with the Lord of all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajr ۖ in ajriya illā `alā rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.arabic: أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Observe the full measure, and do not be of those who give short measure.
ayas.transliteration: awful kayla walā takūnū minal mukhsirīn

ayas.translation: Weigh with an even balance,

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
ayas.translation: and do not cheat the people of their goods. Do not act wickedly on the earth, causing corruption.
ayas.transliteration: walā tabkhasun nāsa ashyā-ahum walā ta`thaw fil-arḍi mufsidīn

ayas.translation: Be wary of Him who created you and the earlier generations.’
They said, ‘Indeed you are one of the bewitched.

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
ayas.translation: You are just a human being like us, and we indeed consider you to be a liar.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā anta illā basharun mithlunā wa in naẓunnuka laminal kādhibīn

ayas.arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Make a fragment of the sky falls upon us, should you be truthful.’
ayas.transliteration: fa-asqiṭ `alaynā kisafan minas samā-i in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

ayas.translation: He said, ‘My Lord knows best what you are doing.’

ayas.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
ayas.translation: So they impugned him, and then they were overtaken by the punishment of the day of the overshadowing cloud. It was indeed the punishment of a terrible day.
ayas.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-akhadhahum `adhābu yawmiẓ ẓullah ۚ innahu kāna `adhāba yawmin `aẓīm

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.
ayas.transliteration: inna fī dhālika la-āyah ۖ wa mā kāna aktharuhum mu-minīn

ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.
This is indeed [a Book] sent down by the Lord of all the worlds,
brought down by the Trustworthy Spirit
upon your heart (so that you may be one of the warners),
in a clear Arabic language.
It is indeed [foretold] in the scriptures of the ancients.

ayas.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
ayas.translation: Is it not a sign for them that the learned of the Children of Israel recognize it?
ayas.transliteration: awalam yakun lahum āyatan an ya`lamahu `ulamā-u banī isrā-iyl

ayas.translation: Had We sent it down upon some non-Arab

ayas.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
This is how We let it pass through the hearts of the guilty:

ayas.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
ayas.translation: they do not believe in it until they sight the painful punishment.
It will overtake them suddenly while they are unaware.
Thereupon they will say, ‘Shall we be granted any respite?’
So do they seek to hasten on Our punishment?
Tell me, should We let them enjoy for some years,
then there comes to them what they have been promised,

ayas.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
ayas.translation: of what avail to them will be that which they were given to enjoy?

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
ayas.translation: We have not destroyed any town without its having warners,
ayas.transliteration: wa mā ahlaknā min qaryatin illā lahā mundhirūn

ayas.translation: for the sake of admonition, and We were not unjust.
It has not been brought down by the devils.
Neither does it behoove them, nor are they capable [of doing that].
ayas.transliteration: wa mā yanbaghī lahum wa mā yastaṭī`ūn

ayas.translation: Indeed, they are kept at bay [even] from hearing it.

ayas.arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
ayas.translation: So do not invoke any god besides Allah, lest you should be among the punished.
ayas.transliteration: falā tad`u ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhara fatakūna minal mu`adhhabīn

ayas.translation: Warn the nearest of your kinsfolk,

ayas.arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: and lower your wing to the faithful who follow you.

ayas.arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: But if they disobey you, say, ‘I am absolved of what you do.’
ayas.transliteration: fa-in `aṣawka faqul innī barī-un mimmā ta`malūn

ayas.translation: And put your trust in the All-mighty, the All-merciful,
who sees you when you stand [for prayer],
and your going about among those who prostrate.
Indeed He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.

ayas.arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
ayas.translation: Should I inform you on whom the devils descend?
They descend on every sinful liar.
They eavesdrop, and most of them are liars.
As for the poets, [only] the perverse follow them.

ayas.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
ayas.translation: Have you not regarded that they rove in every valley,
ayas.transliteration: alam tara annahum fī kulli wādiy yahīmūn

ayas.translation: and that they say what they do not do?

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
ayas.translation: Barring those who have faith, do righteous deeds, and remember Allah much often, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged. And the wrongdoers will soon know at what goal they will end up.
ayas.transliteration: illal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti wadhakarullāha kathīran wantaṣarū min ba`di mā ẓulimū ۗ wasaya`lamul ladhīna ẓalamū ayya munqalabiy yanqalibūn
